hero.title: Discover Your
hero.subtitle: Take our MBTI-based personality test and unlock personalized travel recommendations that match your unique style and preferences.

features.title: Why Take the Test?
features.subtitle: Our MBTI-based analysis provides deep insights into your travel personality, helping you make better vacation decisions and discover new experiences.

items.title: Personality Analysis
items.description: Discover your MBTI type through scientifically-designed questions.

items.title: Travel Recommendations
items.description: Get personalized travel suggestions that match your unique personality traits.

items.title: Better Decisions
items.description: Make informed travel choices that align with your natural preferences.

header.title: Travel Personality Assessment
header.subtitle: Answer honestly to get the most accurate results

question.label: Question
question.selectHint: Please select the option that best describes you

navigation.selectAnswer: Please select an answer before proceeding

error.title: Unable to Load Test
error.message: There was an error loading the test questions. Please try again.

q1.text: When planning a trip, you prefer to:

answers.q1a1: Research and book group tours with lots of social activities
answers.q1a2: Plan some group activities but also ensure quiet time alone
answers.q1a3: Focus on solo experiences or very small, intimate groups

q2.text: At your ideal travel destination, you would:

answers.q2a1: Seek out bustling markets, festivals, and social hotspots
answers.q2a2: Balance popular attractions with quieter, less crowded spots
answers.q2a3: Prefer secluded beaches, quiet museums, or peaceful nature walks

q3.text: When meeting other travelers, you typically:

answers.q3a1: Easily strike up conversations and make new friends
answers.q3a2: Are friendly but selective about who you spend time with
answers.q3a3: Prefer to observe and connect with just a few people deeply

q4.text: After a full day of traveling and sightseeing, you:

answers.q4a1: Feel energized and want to explore nightlife or social venues
answers.q4a2: Enjoy a good meal and some social time before resting
answers.q4a3: Need quiet time alone to recharge and process the day

q5.text: When choosing a destination, what appeals to you most?

answers.q5a1: Concrete experiences: great food, comfortable hotels, proven attractions
answers.q5a2: A mix of must-see sights and opportunities for discovery
answers.q5a3: The potential for unique experiences and hidden meanings

answers.q6a1: Provide detailed facts, practical tips, and tried-and-true recommendations
answers.q6a2: Offer both essential information and some creative suggestions
answers.q6a3: Inspire with stories, possibilities, and unconventional perspectives

q7.text: When exploring a new city, you prefer to:

answers.q7a1: Follow recommended routes and visit all the main landmarks
answers.q7a2: See key sights but also allow time for spontaneous discoveries
answers.q7a3: Wander freely and see where your curiosity leads you

q8.text: What type of cultural experience excites you most?

answers.q8a1: Hands-on workshops, cooking classes, or traditional crafts
answers.q8a2: A combination of interactive experiences and learning opportunities
answers.q8a3: Abstract art galleries, philosophical discussions, or spiritual retreats

q9.text: When documenting your travels, you focus on:

answers.q9a1: Specific details: what you ate, where you stayed, practical observations
answers.q9a2: Both concrete memories and emotional impressions
answers.q9a3: The deeper meaning, connections, and transformative insights

q10.text: When choosing between two travel options, you typically:

answers.q10a1: Compare costs, benefits, and logical pros and cons
answers.q10a2: Consider both practical factors and how each option feels
answers.q10a3: Go with what feels right and aligns with your values

q11.text: If something goes wrong during your trip, you:

answers.q11a1: Analyze the problem objectively and find the most efficient solution
answers.q11a2: Address the practical issues while considering everyone's feelings
answers.q11a3: Focus on maintaining harmony and ensuring everyone feels supported

q12.text: When choosing travel companions, you prioritize:

answers.q12a1: People who are reliable, punctual, and share similar travel goals
answers.q12a2: A balance of compatibility and shared interests
answers.q12a3: People you connect with emotionally and who share your values

q13.text: Your approach to travel budgeting is:

answers.q13a1: Methodical and data-driven, optimizing value for money
answers.q13a2: Practical but flexible based on circumstances
answers.q13a3: Flexible and values-based, spending on what matters to you personally

q14.text: When interacting with locals, you're most interested in:

answers.q14a1: Learning about systems, economics, and how things work
answers.q14a2: Understanding both cultural systems and personal stories
answers.q14a3: Personal stories, emotions, and human connections

answers.q15a1: Detailed itineraries planned well in advance
answers.q15a2: A rough framework with some flexibility built in

q16.text: When your travel plans get disrupted, you:

answers.q16a1: Feel stressed and work quickly to restore order and structure
answers.q16a2: Adapt reasonably well while trying to maintain some structure
answers.q16a3: See it as an adventure and opportunity for unexpected discoveries

answers.q17a1: Organized lists, everything planned and packed days in advance
answers.q17a2: Generally organized but might pack some things last minute
answers.q17a3: Last-minute packing, bringing what feels right in the moment

q18.text: During your trip, you prefer to:

answers.q18a1: Stick to your planned schedule and check things off your list
answers.q18a2: Follow your plan but remain open to interesting opportunities
answers.q18a3: Keep your schedule flexible and adapt based on what you discover

ENTJ.name: The Commander
ENTJ.description: Strategic and goal-oriented travelers who love luxury experiences and efficient planning.

ENTP.name: The Debater
ENTP.description: Innovative and spontaneous travelers who thrive on new ideas and unexpected discoveries.

INTJ.name: The Architect
INTJ.description: Independent and strategic travelers who prefer well-researched, meaningful journeys.

INTP.name: The Thinker
INTP.description: Curious and analytical travelers who enjoy exploring ideas and unconventional paths.

ENFJ.name: The Protagonist
ENFJ.description: Inspiring and people-focused travelers who create meaningful connections and experiences.

ENFP.name: The Campaigner
ENFP.description: Enthusiastic and creative travelers who seek authentic experiences and human connections.

INFJ.name: The Advocate
INFJ.description: Visionary and purposeful travelers who seek transformative and meaningful journey experiences.

INFP.name: The Mediator
INFP.description: Creative and values-driven travelers who seek authentic and personally meaningful experiences.

ESTJ.name: The Executive
ESTJ.description: Organized and efficient travelers who prefer structured itineraries and reliable experiences.

ESTP.name: The Entertainer
ESTP.description: Energetic and spontaneous travelers who love adventure and hands-on experiences.

ISTJ.name: The Logistician
ISTJ.description: Methodical and reliable travelers who prefer well-planned, traditional travel experiences.

ISTP.name: The Virtuoso
ISTP.description: Practical and adaptable travelers who enjoy hands-on exploration and mechanical interests.

ESFJ.name: The Consul
ESFJ.description: Social and caring travelers who prioritize group harmony and cultural experiences.

ESFP.name: The Entertainer
ESFP.description: Fun-loving and spontaneous travelers who seek exciting and social travel experiences.

ISFJ.name: The Protector
ISFJ.description: Thoughtful and caring travelers who prefer safe, comfortable, and meaningful experiences.

ISFP.name: The Adventurer
ISFP.description: Gentle and artistic travelers who seek beautiful, authentic, and personally meaningful experiences.

header.personalSubtitle: Discover how your MBTI personality type influences your travel preferences and style
header.sharedSubtitle: Someone shared their MBTI travel personality with you! See how this personality type influences travel preferences and style.

loading.title: Loading Your Results
loading.message: Analyzing your personality and travel preferences...

error.title: Results Not Found
error.message: We couldn't find your test results. Please take the test again.
error.noResults: No test results found. Please complete the personality test first.
error.loadFailed: Failed to load your results. Please try again.
error.invalidType: Invalid personality type in shared link.

understanding.title: Understanding Your Results
understanding.description: Your MBTI travel personality type is based on your responses to questions across four key dimensions. This analysis helps you understand your natural travel preferences, from destination choices to planning styles, enabling you to make more informed travel decisions that align with your personality.

header.title: ‚úàÔ∏è Your Travel Style
header.description: Based on your personality type, here are personalized travel recommendations that align with your preferences and style.

travelRecommendations.showMore: See all travel recommendations in your full results

accessibility.description: Travel recommendations section displaying personalized preferences based on your personality type.

ENTP.planningStyle: Flexible framework with room for spontaneity

INTP.planningStyle: Loose structure with flexibility for discoveries
INTP.budgetApproach: Economical with splurges on interesting finds

INFP.budgetApproach: Value-conscious with splurges on meaningful experiences

ESTP.budgetApproach: Spend on experiences in the moment

ISFJ.budgetApproach: Conservative spending with focus on others

ISFP.planningStyle: Flexible planning with room for beauty

share.title: Share Your Travel Style
share.subtitle: Let your friends discover their MBTI travel personality too!
share.privacy: Your shared link includes your personality type results but no personal data
